text: idea: Smart content that is based on UTM parameters
Could you use hubl to grab a query string value and then use an if statement to display the appropriate content?
Wouldn't that be nice if there were the dependents included in the CMS Template API response? So we could bulk delete every template resources that are not being used
You can do this. If you go by Referral source. It allows you to access UTM_campaign & UTM_source
<@UDU6KEBFB> i currently only see referral source type and it doesn’t give any options to define what UTM_campaign & UTM_source
are you in the PAge editor or are you creating a template?
well in fact each options in the dropdown is in fact related to a utm parameter

Thats not exactly what I need, i need to be able to define UTM parameters for campaigns coming in from facebook from a specific ad targeted at a specific audience.  HubSpot is only letting me attribute it to campaigns created in HubSpot
yes but  you should create every facebook campaign you have as a HubSpot campaign
Paid Social is the only source that is not available for smart rules, but if you create a HubSpot campaign for your facebook campaign you'll be able to use this campaign as a smart rule

you could also do this by coding your rule directly in your page template: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/snippets/design/how-to-display-smart-content-to-anonymous-site-visitors-based-on-http-request>
